examples.text: My brother <w>Toby</w> is coming to visit us this weekend.
I asked <w>Toby</w> if he wanted to join our football team.

senses.sense_definition: A surname derived from the name Tobias.

examples.text: Mr. <w>Toby</w> signed the contract on behalf of the company.
We are going to visit the <w>Toby</w> family next week.
She introduced herself as <w>Toby</w> at the party.
Her daughter <w>Toby</w> loves to paint pictures.

senses.sense_definition: The dog character in a traditional Punch and Judy puppet show.

examples.text: The children laughed when <w>Toby</w> bit the puppet's nose.
The puppeteer brought out <w>Toby</w> to collect money from the audience.

senses.sense_definition: A drinking mug shaped like a human head or figure, typically wearing a tricorn hat.

examples.text: The collector displayed a rare antique <w>toby</w> on the shelf.
He poured the ale into a ceramic <w>toby</w> shaped like a sailor.

senses.sense_definition: A valve connecting a building's water pipes to the main water supply.

examples.text: The plumber had to turn off the <w>toby</w> to fix the leak.
We could not find the <w>toby</w> located under the pavement outside.

senses.sense_definition: The manager or superintendent in charge of a street market.

examples.text: The stallholders paid their weekly rent to the <w>toby</w>.
You must ask the <w>toby</w> for permission to set up a stall here.

senses.sense_definition: The road or highway, often used in the context of tramping or itinerant living.

examples.text: The old man had spent many years living on the <w>toby</w>.
He preferred life on the <w>toby</w> to working in a factory.

senses.sense_definition: A type of small marine fish, such as a pufferfish or the Moorish idol.

examples.text: The diver spotted a colorful <w>toby</w> swimming near the reef.
We saw a small <w>toby</w> in the tropical aquarium.
He sat on the porch smoking a cheap <w>toby</w>.
The shop sold every kind of tobacco, from fine cigars to a simple <w>toby</w>.
